sentence: Lack of early design validation causing rework and re-creation Users, including partners and suppliers, struggle to view and share multi-CAD design data Inability to validate cost, product and service compliance during the design phase Lack of visibility into supply chain / manufacturing data, compliance and risk for design decisions Lack of traceability between software requirements and code, and visibility into release readiness Lack of integrated view of service organization or service network Lack of collaboration due to disconnected engineering disciplines; no cross-discipline view Limited visibility into product performance, usage, environment and quality Inability for non-CAD users to visualize / interrogate data and provide input during product development Inconsistent, inefficient and fragmented hardware, software and systems engineering processes Lack of standardization, reuse and repurpose; re-creation of designs and revalidation of requirements Cost / compliance data is scattered across systems and disconnected from the product definition Inconsistent processes to identify / engage suppliers and communicate product / part requirements Difficulty predicting product development projects cost and time to complete Difficulty managing change across engineering, manufacturing, production and service Inflexible across manufacturing sites; lack of manufacturing process / resource reuse Difficulty providing accurate manufacturing information to production on time Limited lifecycle traceability across requirements, system models, designs and test cases Inability to manage or rapidly implement changing product, software and service requirements Inability to meet local market demands / customer requirements or easily penetrate new markets Increasing product, regulation and service complexity (global, local) Duplicate or disparate parts, materials and suppliers across product lines; common cost variance Difficult to predict / track quality and feedback and identify root cause; rising warranty repair costs Poor capture and management of quality-related feedback causing repeated problems Unidentified field-failure trends; ongoing product quality and performance issues Poor quality, inaccurate or overly complex service information Inability to manage and optimize product architecture to efficiently meet local demands Inefficient warranty support process; OEMs recover little of warranty costs Poor user experience ordering parts, requesting and receiving service; slow response / resolution times High customer support call volumes; unnecessary / multiple dispatches Lack of field technician visibility into parts / service information; inefficient service / diagnostic processes High service workforce turnover or technician downtime; reliance on aging / experienced workforce Unable to balance utilization across planned / break-fix or expand service into new markets Lack of accurate and automated parts planning result in excessive and obsolete parts inventory Missed service level agreement (SLA) compliance Inefficient warranty contract sales process; low install base penetration of service contracts High or unscheduled product / equipment downtime; poor product performance Disparate and redundant data sources, lack of current “single source of truth” IoT application development tools limit rapid innovation and modification Long IoT project cycles; inability to securely connect products and manage data Inability to secure, reuse and share data and intellectual property Lack of secure access on multiple platforms (desktop, mobile, cloud) Poor application / system performance; difficult scaling technology to meet evolving business needs Increase market share, revenue and growth Decrease warranty costs as a percent of revenue; warranty efficiency Increase Service and parts revenue and profitability Increase revenue from new products or new variant Effective useage of R&D expense; total development cost per project / budget Cut rework costs Reduce scrap costs Reduce product cost and cost of goods sold (COGS) Reduce service costs Reduce IT spend  Decrease spend per supplier; material cost variance  On-time delivery or time in design phase Reduce time doing non-value-add activities  Reduce engineering time spent on rework Measure average ECO (Engineering Change Order) and software change cycle-time Meausre number of ECOs to fix quality / compliance issues; ECOs after product release  Visualization of field technician utilization rate  Faster software development cycle time; IoT application development time Reuse of requirements, designs, processes and test assets  Visualization of manufacturing cycle time; overall equipment effectiveness (OEE) Reuse of parts in BOM or software asset reuse; resource and tool reuse  Improve first time fix rate (FTFR)  Reduce number of physical prototypes Evaluate number of new parts or software features introduced and introduction rate Measure product failure rate (e.g. MTBF, mean time between failure)  Shorter mean time to repair (MTTR) Recude inventory turns, costs and parts inventory turnover rate Measure first-time yield Measure number of products launched at cost target per budget  Measure warranty and service contract renewal rate; new service business per new markets  Visualization of number of days for NPI (new product introduction) or time-to-market on average Measure SLA (Service Level Agreement) compliance; Visualization of product per part or technician availability  Visualization of number of recalls, exceptions, warning letters, rework and audits  Count number of occurrences of lost intellectual property (IP) Decrease of number of occurrences of non-compliance in global markets Reduce fines and liability or lost revenue due to compliance issues and missed SLAs Improve customer satisfaction, loyalty scores and net promoter score (NPS) Measure average resolution time, customer wait time; remote fix rate Improve equipment up-time / product quality  Improve Employee satisfaction

sentence: Improving customer satisfaction Business Efficiency Labor management (safety, health) Meeting deadlines Soft customer service Excellent talent Tacit Knowledge Formalization Safe, secure labor management Management data integration Consulting to walk in harmony with manufacturing SMEs Administrative inefficiencies Failure of the machine Claims, damages Employees get along well with each other Friendly with customers The company and the union get along well Tools to analyze data and make feedback possible Introduction of tools to gather information automatically (sensors, cameras, etc.) Tools to collect and store data Increase the salary of all those who work by an average of 1.5 times Product Promotions Manufacturing System Product Development Speed The presence of a talented engineer Sales Force Fieldism Utilizing Digital Tools Shared management and employee awareness Visualization of business efficiency Everything in the company is connected to digital tools and the Internet, and all management decisions can be made in the environment. Eliminate human work to the maximum extent possible, and build a system of skills transfer by digitizing know-how. In terms of sales, digital tools are used to improve efficiency and create an environment that allows for accurate decisions directly related to manufacturing. Unable to pass on skills. Lack of communication (poor communication) Entering the same item over and over again (no data sharing). System incompatibility Have a diverse workforce (foreign, elderly, young) Individuals are good at a variety of things 100 years ago technology and the most advanced technology Linking each system Visualize Information Digitize paper information (drawings, working papers) Contributing to the improvement of productivity of local small and medium-sized manufacturing industries with its original AI, and contributing to the development of Kitakyushu City. Achieved 5 billion yen in sales. Reluctance to take on new challenges Interdepartmental information sharing (tools are available but less proactive) Training employees over 50 years old (management skills, IT skills) Employees are honest and diligent Asking for dreams, thank you rather than profit and loss Goods that can be sold worldwide Digitization of information on the manufacturing floor (IoT) Systems that can analyze information more efficiently (use of AI) Gathering feedback on product services from customers (efficiently) Everything is data-intensive and all employees can look at it and think for themselves while working. A company where everyone is free from useless management and enjoys and is motivated by their work.

The president doesn't listen to the department heads. Unable to generate new business No one is willing to work on improving the business Seven jobs could be experienced Improvement by AR in assembly New business (to be generated from Japan, not just an improvement) Each company operates a disguised currency (thank you) consideration We want to create a common Japanese platform for virtual currency to give thanks to each other in the company Sales Target Bias Load bias Accurate Costing The Mind of Human Resources High sales for the size of the company Accounts with large companies (accounts on a smaller scale) Realization of the assembly process using AR (manufacturing) Putting sensors in manufactured goods (goods) to enhance condition monitoring and after-sales service Put a counter (sensor) in the manufactured items and launch a subscription service Leading an organization with 1 billion in sales / 100 million in profit in Osaka Delay in development planning Aging system (update) Securing sales (plan) Leading market share in a particular product Providing products to key industries The only domestic product Converting Products to IoT Digitalization and utilization of data (educational materials, product materials), processes as well Formalization of personal skills To be a muscular company that can move and give back profitably by providing new value through DX The details of the manufacturing process are not centralized Information between processes is not always shared Figures (cost, selling price) are not immediately predictable Many people follow company policies on the surface Employees are less opposed to the introduction of systematization (tools) such as Listen to your employees Centralization of scattered data in each process Handing down the field, digitizing manuals Shared data utilization, systematization Stable management with balanced product mix
